void CRPGraphHelper::drawGlyphDataCoord ( CDC *  pDC,
double  x,
double  y,
int  type 
)

Draw a glyph given data coordinates.

This function will convert to drawing canvas coordinates before drawing the glyph. Drawing will be done with canvas presets so you can set them before calling this.

void CRPGraphHelper::drawTextDataCoord ( CDC *  pDC,
double  x,
double  y,
CString  text,
double  ptht = 0,
CString  face = "",
UINT  align = 0 
)

Draw a string at given data coordinates.

This function will convert to drawing canvas coordinates before drawing the text. Drawing will be done with canvas presets so you can set them before calling this.

void CRPGraphHelper::drawTraceDataCoord ( CDC *  pDC,
int  npts,
double *  x,
double *  y 
)

Draw a trace given data coordinates.

This functions will convert to drawing canvas coordinates before drawing the trace. Drawing will be done with canvas presets so you can set them before calling this.

void CRPGraphHelper::getGraphRect ( LPRECT  vrect  )  [inline]

Get the inner canvas rectangle This way we don't need to redraw axes to set that boundary

void CRPGraphHelper::setClipRectangle ( CDC *  pDC,
LPRECT  clrect 
)

Set clip rectangle.

This is a helper function to deal with the idiosyncracies of drawing vs. printing canvases and the different clip rectangles they need You probably want to wrap any call to this into a SaveDC / RestoreDC pair ...
